intro: Blakea longipes, commonly known as the longipes balsa, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers and palmately lobed leaves. It typically grows as an epiphyte on trees in humid, shaded environments. Blakea longipes is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
